image.altText: A group of men in suits getting into a car.

props.synopsis: Slovakia's Prime Minister Robert Fico has been shot after a government meeting in the town of Handlova.

title.children: Slovakia's PM shot outside government meeting

image.altText: Protesters clash outside a Cumberland City Council

props.synopsis: Cumberland City Council has voted to overturn a controversial ban on same-sex parenting books from its librariesÂ after more than four hours of debate.

title.children: Western Sydney council votes to overturn ban on same-sex parenting books in libraries after lengthy debate

image.altText: Michelle Bulang in her kitchen with light pink walls and pie tins in front of her.

props.synopsis: In the Philippines women who are abused by their husband have an even more difficult time leaving. Divorce is not an avenue available to them.

title.children: Michelle's husband beat her and her children. She still can't legally divorce him

image.altText: A composite image of an older man and an older woman smiling.

props.synopsis: The daughter of Carol Clay tells a Victorian court her mother had a "very loving and caring" relationship with Russell Hill, with whom she was allegedly murdered during a camping trip in 2020.

title.children: Court hears details of Victorian camper's last radio call on night of alleged murder

image.altText: A red Australia Post electric sign

props.synopsis: The government is warning taxpayers may have to step in to prop up Australia Post, with the federal budget sounding the alarm for the organisation's financial position.

title.children: Taxpayers warned the public may have to prop up Australia Post

image.altText: A graphic image showing the NDIS logo, a hand on a calculator, and stacks of folders.

props.synopsis: Disability was a big part of this year's federal budget. Here are the key takeaways now the dust has settled.

title.children: From NDIS cost revisions to a new employment program, what's in the budget for disability?

image.altText: A distraught middle-aged man and woman stand in front of a grey curtain

props.synopsis: It's been almost two weeks since Kye Schaefer was fatally stabbed in Coffs Harbour. His parents are calling on the person responsible to be "honest and own up".

title.children: Parents of 21-year-old stabbed to death while heading for a surf issue tearful plea to killer

image.altText: Black snake in ute.

props.synopsis: Newcastle womanÂ Lisa Kournelis has been driving around with a deadly snake in her car for about six weeks. It's not unheard of for snakes to make their way into vehicles, but it is highly unusual for them to linger so long. So why is this one still there?

title.children: Why won't 'Fluffy' the red-bellied black snake leave Lisa's car?

image.altText: A photo graphic of a blurred-out young male on a mobile phone sitting in front of a laptop.

props.synopsis: For up to four weeks, Alex and his family received up to 50 food deliveries a day after his address was shared by someone he had an argument with while playing Call of Duty online. Here's what to do if, like Alex, you've been doxxed.

title.children: Alex was doxxed while playing Call of Duty. What happened next was a living nightmare for him and his family

image.altText: A woman with red short hair in a light blue shirt is in a wheelchair and laughing while in front of a beach outside

props.synopsis: It's Pay Day!Â Elly Desmarchelier shares the financial reality of living with a disability, why salary-sacrificing her car turned out to be a disaster, and the money advice from her parents that she carries with her to this day.

title.children: Salary sacrificing her car taught Elly two valuable lessons: read the damn contract and plan for the worst

image.altText: A composite image of a woman in a black hoodie, a loveheart-shaped pin of two boys, and a third boy in school uniform

props.synopsis: Wendy Elizabeth Chattaway was previously jailed for 12 months for lying to police about her role in a horror crash that claimed the lives of a mother and three children at Yanco near Leeton during 2023.

title.children: Driver involved in crash that killed woman and three children avoids time behind bars

image.altText: a composite image of Heidi Klum, Farhana Bodhi, Greta Gerwig and Jane Fonda

props.synopsis: We're gearing up for a glut of red carpet moments from the south of France in the coming days. Here's a quick recap of the looks we saw at the opening ceremony.

title.children: Cannes Film Festival fashion: Jane Fonda, Meryl Streep, Heidi Klum and a pair of hoof-like shoes

image.altText: An illustration of a white balloon floating in front of clouds in the sky.

props.synopsis: Critics line up as Australia's most in-debt state takes its largest venture capitalist gamble yet, betting on a US satellite imagery and space tourism company.

title.children: Victoria launches $37 million gamble on space tourism as critics lament debt balloon

image.altText: Sparks flying near workers operating near a furnace.

props.synopsis: The government's proposed $7-billion tax break for nickel and lithium projects has drawn the ire of Opposition Leader Peter Dutton, but the measure has broad support in Western Australia, including from one Liberal MP.

title.children: Opposition hits out at 'billions for billionaires' tax incentives for critical minerals projects

image.altText: protest

props.synopsis: The students say they were told by the university to leave the encampment, which was set up in solidarity with the people of Gaza, but say they were not given any reasons.

title.children: Seven students say they were asked to leave pro-Palestine encampment at Australian National University

image.altText: A male figure skater in a black outfit squats down and holds his foot with his hand as he spins

props.synopsis: The ruling by the US Center for SafeSport bans Kerry for life from any events or activities controlled by the US Olympic and Paralympic Committee.

title.children: Australian Olympic figure skater Brendan Kerry banned by US sport safety body for sexual misconduct

image.altText: A large classical sandstone building with columns

props.synopsis: AÂ former couple charged with numerous child exploitation and sexual abuse offences will have 27 charges withdrawn, while more than 60 other charges remain against the pair.

title.children: Foster parents who allegedly sexually abused children facing more than 60 charges

image.altText: Cody Walker and Latrell Mitchell stand together before a South Sydney NRL match.

props.synopsis: The NRL takes action after South Sydney's Latrell Mitchell and Cody Walker were allegedlyÂ vilified during Saturday's match against St George Illawarra.

title.children: NRL bans two spectators over alleged racial abuse of Rabbitohs duo

image.altText: Budget 2024-25 papers with the deficit line overlaid and some additional graphic treatment.

props.synopsis: The federal budget is in its second year of surplus, but is poised to fall back into deficit for the next decade. Why? And should we be worried?

title.children: You can't have a surplus and your tax cuts too â why Australia's budget will be in the red for a decade

image.altText: Jim Chalmers stands at the podium of the national press club

props.synopsis: With an eye to the next election, Treasurer Jim Chalmers spruiked what he saw as the government's economic achievements in last night's budget speech. But did he stick to the facts?

title.children: We fact checked some key claims from Jim Chalmers's budget speech. Here's what we found

image.altText: A Qantas plane taxies along a runway in overcast conditions while passengers seated inside watch on.

props.synopsis: The federal government says Australia's intake of migrants will fall sharply â halving in two years â as it overhauls the migration system and moves to reduce pressures caused by population growth.

title.children: Immigration is set to drop sharply, but experts say the government shouldn't claim much credit

image.altText: A man and a woman stand next to each other crossing their arms. There is a construction fence behind them.

props.synopsis: Christian Brothers' High School Lewisham is one of a few Sydney private schools demolishing residential property to add new facilities, but questions have been raised about whether the expansion plans are appropriate during a housing crisis.

title.children: Anger as Sydney private school demolishes apartment block amid housing crisis

image.altText: A protest in Melbourne's CBD

props.synopsis: Hundreds of marching students call on their universities to cut ties with companies linked to Israel, as administrators urge protesters to pack up their campsites.

title.children: Melbourne University students occupy building on campus in protest against Israel ties

image.altText: A historical statue cut down and vandalised.

props.synopsis: In the 1860s, there was a "loathsome" rush to collect the bones of Aboriginal Tasmanians. It sparked a shameful saga, centring on unsuspecting Aboriginal man William Lanne, and aspiring politician William Crowther. It echoes to this day â culminating in the toppling of a statue in Hobart.

title.children: William Crowther's statue was toppled in Hobart â why is he such a divisive figure?

image.altText: A person's arms are pictured shaping a heart with its hands, behind it a large round portal in which people in Dublin are seen

props.synopsis: Officials have hit a pause on a video screen called The Portal that lets people in New York and Dublin peer into life on opposite sides of the Atlantic in real time.

title.children: Sidewalk video portal connecting New York and Dublin paused after spectators caught misbehaving on camera

image.altText: A man sits on the bed of an MRI machine looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: Richard Scolyer, who has treated his stage four brain cancer using his own research, has announced his latest scans show no new cancer growth one year after his initial diagnosis.Â

title.children: Australian of the Year brain cancer free one year on from diagnosis

image.altText: Hands holding a power bill

props.synopsis: Tuesday's budget had a few measures that could put extra money in your pocket.Â But don't expect a cheque in the mail or a bonus payment directly into your bank account.Â

title.children: How you'll get the $300 energy rebate promised in Tuesday's budget

image.altText: Shiny silver coins on display inside the Mint with an effigy of King Charles III on the back.

props.synopsis: The first full proof set of Australian coins bearing the face of King Charles III was unveiled at the Royal Australian Mint in Canberra today, and they've been described as "a beautiful memento of an important change in the framework of Australia".

title.children: For the first time in 59 years, a king will appear on all of Australia's newly minted coins

image.altText: Shane walks along carrying documents and wearing sunglasses.

props.synopsis: A group of Australian Federal Police officers file a case against the ACT government and former ACT top prosecutor Shane Drumgold over comments he made after the trial of Mr Lehrmann collapsed.

title.children: Former ACT prosecutor sued for defamation by AFP officers over allegations of interference in Bruce Lehrmann case

image.altText: Kevin Gallagher wears a suit at a press conference in Darwin.

props.synopsis: Gas giant Santos sacks about 200 staff members, most of them based in Perth, citing slower project approval times.

title.children: 'Surplus to our business activity': Gas giant Santos lays off about 200 Perth workers

image.altText: A tight shot of the 2024/2025 federal budget.

props.synopsis: A $300 energy bill credit for every household, a 10 per cent increase to Commonwealth rent assistance and capped PBS medicine prices headline a budget aimed at easing living costs and bolstering the government's pre-election standing.

title.children: Every household to get $300 credit for energy bills as government vows move will reduce inflation

image.altText: Two children with muddy, sad faces look over their shoulders towards camera

props.synopsis: Known for his Palme d'Or-winning film Shoplifters, Japanese director Hirokazu Kore-eda is back, lending his signature warmth to this complicated drama.

title.children: Who is the victim and who is the so-called monster in this twisty Japanese family drama?
